intro: Acourtia wislizeni var. subscaposa, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial with a rosette of basal leaves that are typically gray-green in color. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by small, spiky fruits. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. The species is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient member of desert ecosystems.
